case_vignette: A 27-year-old man is brought into the emergency department by ambulance. The patient was at an appointment to receive welfare when he began acting abnormally. The patient was denied welfare. Shortly afterwards, he no longer responded to questions and stared blankly off into space, not responding to verbal stimuli. Other than odd lip-smacking behavior, he was motionless. Several minutes later, he became responsive but seemed confused. The patient has a past medical history of drug abuse and homelessness and is not currently taking any medications. His temperature is 98.9°F (37.2°C), blood pressure is 124/78 mmHg, pulse is 90/min, respirations are 14/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. Physical exam reveals cranial nerves II-XII as grossly intact with 5/5 strength in the upper and lower extremities and a stable gait. The patient seems confused when answering questions and has trouble remembering the episode.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I started acting weirdly, then I zoned out and wasn't responding to people talking to me, and I was doing this odd thing with my lips like I was smacking them together. Now I’m feeling confused and can't really remember what happened.
How long did this episode last?
The episode lasted for several minutes before I became responsive again.
Have you ever had a similar episode before?
I can't remember if this has happened before.
Do you have a history of neurological issues, such as epilepsy or seizures?
I have a history of drug abuse, but I don't know about any neurological issues.
Are you currently on any medications or drugs, prescribed or otherwise?
No, I'm not taking any medications right now.
Is there any family history of epilepsy or other seizure disorders?
I don't know about any family history of those conditions.
Have you had any recent head injuries or infections?
I haven't had any recent head injuries or infections that I'm aware of.
Are there any other symptoms you experienced recently, such as headaches, dizziness, or visual disturbances?
No, I haven't had any headaches, dizziness, or problems with my vision.
Final Diagnosis: Complex partial seizure (focal onset impaired awareness seizure).
